intro: Triumfetta pedunculata var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant features small, opposite leaves that are usually smooth and glabrous, giving it its varietal name. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are typically white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
